intro: Hedysarum kalatense, commonly known as the Kalatense sweet clover, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Hedysarum kalatense is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it useful in ecological restoration projects.
